title: PHPendifKeyword

metadata.description: Learn about PHPendifKeyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
End an
if
conditional:
<?php
$a = 4;
if($a < 5):
echo "Less than five";
endif;
?>

Definition and Usage
The
endif
keyword is used to mark the end of an
if
conditional which was started with
the
if(...):
syntax. It also applies to any variation of the
if
conditional, such as
if...elseif
and
if...else
.
Related Pages
The
if
keyword.
The
else
keyword.
The
elseif
keyword.
Read more about conditional statements in our
PHP if else Tutorial
.
More Examples
Example
End an
if...else
conditional:
<?php
$a = 4;
if($a < 5):
echo "Less than five";
else:
echo "Greater than five";
endif;
?>

Example
End an
if...elseif...else
conditional:
<?php
$a = 4;
if($a < 5):
echo "Less than five";
elseif($a < 10):
echo "More than five but less than ten";
else:
echo "Greater than ten";
endif;
?>

★
+1

practice_exercises.solution:

echo "Greater than five";
endif;
?>

summary: This tutorial covers PHPendifKeyword concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPendifKeyword effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPendifKeyword and how to apply it in your projects.
